column4: http://sine.cluenet.org:8080/~grawity/trash/firefox-socks-config.png
i know does the way i done
/etc/fstab
/etc/fstab command not found
It's a file to edit, not a command.
i can u tell my what i need to edit cos i got no clue
First, run "sudo blkid" and find out the partition's /dev name
Or even better, the UUID.
/dev/sda5: UUID="460063AD0063A2A3" LABEL="WD320" TYPE="ntfs"
Okay. Now where do you want to mount it? /media/somewhere or such.
i just want it to be allway when i restart my machine
You already said that three tiems. Now answer the question.
media should be fine
just like normal hhd
Can you tell the exact path? /media/windows, or /media/media, or /media/WD320, or...
/media/WD320
Okay, now can you type 'id' and paste the output?
uid=1000(zion) gid=1000(zion) groups=4(adm),20(dialout),24(cdrom),46(plugdev),106(lpadmin),121(admin),122(sambashare),1000(zion)
Thanks. I've put the instructions at http://sprunge.us/RCSN
let me try
Oh, one more thing I forgot. Use "gksudo gedit /etc/fstab" to edit that file.
thanks works good
